com.datamirror.ts.api

Interface AlertHandlerIF

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NotificationSample, NotificationSampleToFile

    public interface AlertHandlerIF
    This class contains a single method for handling user exit invocations that are a result of notifications set through Management Console. All notification user exit classes must implement this interface. Notifications are triggered when a message is generated that belongs to a specific functional zone and category. Through Management Console, you can select the functional zone and category combinations for which you will be notified.

    When a notification is raised as a result of a generated InfoSphere CDC message, you can be alerted through a user exit class invocation. The code in the class can perform the necessary operations, such as sending e-mail, to ensure the notification is brought to attention. With this approach you need to identify the name and location of the user exit class that implements the AlertHandlerIF interface. This ensures that the correct class is invoked when a specific notification is raised. The AlertHandlerIF interface for notification user exits is located in the package com.datamirror.ts.api. You can configure notifications for subscriptions or datastores in Management Console. For detailed instructions on how to configure notifications in Management Console, see Management Console - Administration Guide.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void handle(int p_zoneID, int p_categoryID, java.lang.String p_SourceOrTarget, java.lang.String p_Name, int p_EventID, java.lang.String p_EventText, java.util.Properties p_OtherInfo)
      Handles all user exit class invocations that are a result of notifications activated in response to the generation of certain InfoSphere CDC messages.

    • Method Detail

      • handle

        void handle(int p_zoneID,
            int p_categoryID,
            java.lang.String p_SourceOrTarget,
            java.lang.String p_Name,
            int p_EventID,
            java.lang.String p_EventText,
            java.util.Properties p_OtherInfo)
     throws java.lang.Exception
        Handles all user exit class invocations that are a result of notifications activated in response to the generation of certain InfoSphere CDC messages.

        Notifications are set through Management Console by identifying specific functional zone and category combinations. Generated messages that belong to alarmed functional zone and category combinations can produce alerts in the form of user exit class invocations. This method is automatically called each time a notification is raised.

        Parameters:
        p_zoneID - Identifies the functional zone of the generated message. See Management Console - Administration Guide for information about the available functional zones.

        When p_SourceOrTarget is "S":

        • 1 - Scrape/Refresh
        • 2 - Communication
        • 3 - Environment
        • 4 - Journal

        When p_SourceOrTarget is "T":

        • 1 - Communication
        • 2 - Apply
        • 3 - Environment

        p_categoryID - Identifies the category of the generated message, which is an indication of the severity of the message.
        • 1 - Fatal
        • 2 - Error
        • 3 - Information
        • 4 - Status
        • 5 - Operational

        See Management Console - Administration Guide for more information on the categories.

        p_SourceOrTarget - A string containing "S" or "T". Indicates whether the message was generated in the source or target environment.
        • "S" - Indicates the message originated in the source environment.
        • "T" - Indicates the message originated in the target environment.

        p_Name - Identifies the subscription name for messages generated in the source environment (S), or identifies the source identifier for messages generated in the target environment (T).

        p_EventID - An integer that identifies the identification number of the generated message.

        p_EventText - A String containing the text of the message.

        p_OtherInfo - A placeholder for future enhancements.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - any exception
